attributes.action: make it against the law to call someone from a withheld number and not leave a message on voicemail/answer phone
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
One of the most annoying things on the planet is getting home, dialling 1471 only to hear "the caller withheld their number". OK you think, they'll have left a message. So you check the answer phone or 1571 only to find they haven't so you have no idea who called or what they wanted.

The same is of course true of calls received on mobile phones as well.

We petition the prime minister to make it against the law to call someone using a withheld number, and in the case of being diverted to answerphone/voicemail, fail to leave a message clearly identifying who you are and what it is you are calling about and how to call you back

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
Intended to be humorous, or has no point about government policy
